thread.title: The future isn’t what it used to be, unless this is the Cubs’ year
thread.title_full: The future isn’t what it used to be, unless this is the Cubs’ year | The Seattle Times

author: Dwight Perry / Sideline Chatter
title: The future isn’t what it used to be, unless this is the Cubs’ year
text:
Who needs Nostradamus when you have Marty McFly?
In the 1989 film “Back to the Future II,” a serendipitous movie prop — the front page of the Oct. 22, 2015 edition of USA Today — declared that the Cubs won the World Series in five games. 
Headlines • At DerfMagazine.com : “Andy Dalton reads Twitter feed without crying for first time since becoming a Bengal.”
• At SportsPickle.com : “Cubs, Mets admit it would be embarrassing to lose in the playoffs to Mets, Cubs.”
Most Read Stories 12 reasons why living in Washington is better than living in Oregon Renton pot bust: 3,000 marijuana plants, $440,000 seized Why Bremerton coach Joe Kennedy’s stance on postgame prayer is admirable Seahawks fullback Derrick Coleman released from jail Friday Seahawks’ Derrick Coleman arrested for investigation of hit, run Unlimited Digital Access. $1 for 4 weeks. • At TheOnion.com : “NFL to donate all October passing yards to breast-cancer research.”
Road trip! In Pac-12 football play this season, the visiting team won 10 of the first 15 conference games.
Veteran observers say they haven’t seen this much trauma at home since Elin discovered Tiger’s text messages.
Losing with E’s Say this much for the Texas Rangers’ season-ending loss: Elvis’ glove has left the building.
Sleazy Rider Dept. Rider University suspended its entire 28-man cross-country team for one meet for hazing, after campus cops caught the runners about to embark on a naked run.
Or as team apologists tried to spin it, prancing cheek to cheek.
Cut to the Chase “So if Chase Utley retires in the offseason,” wondered Janice Hough of LeftCoastSportsBabe.com , “do they suspend him for his first two old-timers’ games?”
Young Bruin ”UCLA basketball got a verbal commitment from a 13-year-old player,” noted Brad Dickson of the Omaha (Neb.) World-Herald. “I’m trying to confirm that he went with UCLA after coaches told him they’d get his braces off early.”
Young Bruin Oakland A’s GM Billy Beane’s residence used about 6,000 gallons of water daily in drought-stricken California, according to the September report from the East Bay Municipal Utility District, but he’s blaming it on three irrigation leaks.
Looks like finding a stopper will be high on his offseason shopping list.
Talko time • NBC’s Seth Meyers, after Playboy announced it will stop running nude photos next year: “So now if you want to see a naked woman you’ll have to go to HBO, Showtime, Cinemax, the Internet, Burning Man, a PETA protest, perfume ads or ESPN The Magazine.”
• Times reader Bill Littlejohn, after a Japanese swordsman halved a baseball going 100 mph from 30 feet: “Well, it started out as a fastball and ended up being a splitter.”
• RJ Currie of SportsDeke.com , after the Rockets’ James Harden told NBA.com he’s the best player in the NBA and should have been last season’s MVP: “Is it possible for someone’s beard to be too tight?”
What’s shakin’? Oklahoma is experiencing an unusual run of earthquakes and, in neighboring Kansas, 6-foot-7, 410-pound Baylor tight end LaQuan McGowan caught a TD pass against the Jayhawks.
Rival seismologists are still arguing over which state’s ground was rumbling the worst.
Dwight Perry: 206-464-8250 or dperry@seattletimes.com
